Hippomaps
  • Tutorials
  • View page source

Tutorials

These tutorials reproduce the fifures found in HippoMaps (DeKraker et al). They are also meant to serve as examples for common analyses, and to showcase ways of using HippoMaps tools.

Morphology:

  • Overview
  • Histology
  • 7T MRI
  • 3T MRI

Histology-MRI-9p4T:

  • Overview
  • 0) Map volumetric data to surfaces and load (optional)
  • 1) Load and plot all surface data
    • Preprocessing
  • 2) Average eqivalent samples and view profiles
    • Laminar profiles (Prox to Dist) and then (Ant to Post)
    • 4) Summarize data according to primary gradients
    • save

MRI-7T-struct:

  • Overview
  • 0) Map volumetric data to surfaces and load (optional)
  • 1) Load and plot all surface data
    • 2) Stability between subjects
    • 3) lets add another dataset (9.4T data)
    • 4) Make a summary plot of consistency
    • 4) Summarize data according to primary gradients
    • save

MRI-3T-rsfMRI:

  • Overview
    • 0. Map rsfMRI data to hippocampal surfaces
    • 1. Intrinsic Timescale of hippocampal rsfMRI
    • 2. Calcualte Regional Homogeneity
  • 3) tSNR (TODO: get volumetric version generated from micapipe)
    • 4) Functional connectivity of the hippocampus to neocortex
  • 5) Check consistency for all of the above
    • 4. Gradients of differential hippocampal FC
  • save

iEEG:

  • Overview
    • 0) Map data to hippocampal surfaces
    • 1) Load the data and examine attributes
    • Spatial distribution of hippocampal-adjacent channels
    • Compare PSDs from the hippocampus to all chennels to ensure they are comparable
    • Compare BPs from the hippocampus to all chennels to ensure they are comparable
    • Nicer ridge plot, showing hippocampal data in colour and all data in grey behaind
    • Spatial extrapolation
    • 2) Summarize data according to primary gradients
    • save

DimReduct:

  • Overview
  • 1) Load and resample
  • 2) Check for correlations with AP, PD, or subfield organizations
  • 3) Gradient decomposition

MRI-3T-taskfMRI:

  • Overview
    • 0) Map data to hippocampal surface
    • 1.1) GLM fit pattern separation2
  • Now that we’ve run through a full example for one subject, we’ll loop through all subjects and save the data:
    • 1.2) Group-averaging and significance/consistency testing
  • significance testing
  • Additional consistency checks
  • 1.3) Consider neocortical results
  • 1.4) Compare to previously mapped features
    • 2.1) GLM fit for episodic retrieval
    • 2.2) Group-averaging and significance/consistency testing
  • 2.3) Consider the neocortex
    • 3.1) GLM fit for episodic encoding -subsequent memory
    • 3.2) Group-averaging and significance/consistency testing
  • 3.3) Consider the neocortex
